Maybe my imagination, but to my eye many of these
"late" copies (how late remains to be seen I guess)
have a look of a stamped out piece of metal; literally
the design and "flatness" of the metal looks like
it was done with a stamping machine. I'm purely
guessing, but could it be these are modern iai
tsuba that have been "aged" in a bucket of acid
over night (or maybe a little longer)?

Rich S
